body.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Days of Endless Adventure (DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Baldur's Gate)
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Jenson Books Inc and Fulfilled by Amazon.
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Jim Zub is a writer, artist and art instructor based in Toronto, Canada. Over the past fifteen years he's worked for a diverse array of publishing, movie and video game clients including Marvel, DC Comics, Capcom, Hasbro, Cartoon Network, and Bandai-Namco. He juggles his time between being a freelance comic writer and Program Coordinator for Seneca College's award-winning Animation program. His current comic projects include Dungeons & Dragons, a new series celebrating 40 years of the classic tabletop RPG, Thunderbolts, the return of Marvel's villainous superhero team, and Wayward, a modern supernatural story about teens fighting Japanese mythological monsters.Born and raised in Vancouver, British Columbia, Max Dunbar started working in comics in 2012 on Dynamite Comics' Red Sonja: Atlantis Rises. He has worked on such projects as: The Mocking Dead, Dungeons & Dragons, Slash and Burn, Micronauts, Gears of War: Rise of RAAM, and Judge Dredd: Under Siege.

body.description: Go beyond your tabletop campaign--or fuel it with new material--in this collection of immersive graphic novel adventures set in the boundless world of the Forgotten Realms.A new generation of heroes, led by a revived Minsc and Boo, rises to protect Baldur's Gate, but they'll soon find themselves fighting evil forces throughout the Realms and beyond. Whether they're stopping a plot by the Cult of the Dragon to destroy the city; escaping from the endless night of Ravenloft in the Demiplane of Dread; or facing down frost giant raiding parties in the frigid Spine of the World, the action never stops! GO FOR THE EYES, BOO!Collects three graphic novels: Dungeons & Dragons: Legends of Baldur's Gate, Dungeons & Dragons: Shadows of the Vampire, and Dungeons & Dragons: Frost Giant's Fury.Don't miss the companion collection Dungeons & Dragons: Nights of Endless Adventure! Read more

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Dungeons & Dragons: Days of Endless Adventure Rick and Morty vs. Dungeons & Dragons: The Complete Adventures Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves-Feast of the Moon Movie Prequel Comic Dungeons & Dragons: Ravenloft--Orphan of Agony Isle Dungeons & Dragons: Mindbreaker Dungeons & Dragons: At the Spine of the World The worlds of Dungeons & Dragons as you've never seen them before! Fan-favorite characters unite to save Baldur's Gate and embark on a quest that will take them to the frozen Spine of the World, shadowy Ravenloft, and beyond. Collects Legends of Baldur's Gate, Shadows of the Vampire, and Frost Giant's Fury. It's the COMPLETE ADVENTURE! Grab your dice, pencils, and spellbook as Rick and Morty vs. Dungeons & Dragons returns in this min-maxing, saga-spanning collection! Before you catch Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves, in theaters March 31, 2023, make sure to pick up this must-read prequel comic! DISCOVER the Demiplane of Dread! In her castle laboratory, D&D's own mad scientist, Dr. Viktra Mordenheim, performs experiments testing the bounds of science and magic! Some of D&D's most popular villains have invaded the Forgotten Realms, and readers and beloved characters alike will find their very sanity at risk! A new Dungeons & Dragons adventure awaits! Return to Icewind Dale with a new party of adventurers! Can these five unlikely heroes stop the plot of an ancient, primordial evil?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars More with Minsc!
reviews.reviewText: I actually bought this expecting a trio of modules. It is based on said modules, but you’d have to reverse engineer the story and add your own rules legwork to use it that way.In my case, my fiancé just painted the Minsc and Boo figurine that came with a paint set. She’s never played that series of computer games, so it’s a nice fleshing out of the character for her.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun Read, Good Art, Engaging - And Boo!
reviews.reviewText: Disclaimer: I know very little about graphic novels and am not a comics geek.Read this as a class assignment, ended up ordering one for myself to keep. Good expression (which I'm picky about), great backgrounds and the text is big enough for me to see with my 59-year-old self's bifocals.And Boo. Seriously. Just saying "Space Hamster" brightens up my day. Especially if you say it randomly as an exclamation or expletive. Try it in an elevator. Nine times out of ten you'll get the car to yourself. The tenth time someone will yell back "Go for the eyes, Boo!" and you'll make a new friend.Get it, you'll love it! Already preordered another graphic novel in this series that's coming out in February.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tales of a (Miniature) Giant Space Hamster, it's brave but slow witted minion, and a few other tag along heroes
reviews.reviewText: Excellent story about our heroes of Baldurs Gate! Absolutely a !its read for ANY fantasy buff, enjoyed of high fantasy, tall tales (and giants), ranged beasties getting their pale butts kicked and the well deserved serving of hot, fresh justice on a spicy skewer! The true hero is, of course, Boo, whose brave, well meaning but somewhat slow witted man servant Minsc and their friends. Absolutely read this, buy it, borrow it, but read it however you can!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Comics reading for goodness!
reviews.reviewText: These are fun, well-illustrated romps through the Forgotten Realms with the added bonus of Minsc and Boo from the Baldur's Gate series of computer RPGs. If you enjoyed those games or D&D in general, this is worth the purchase. The book itself is a high-quality paperback and fairly hefty. You get your money's worth on this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I started reading without knowing what to expect. Ok it's d&d comic book, but I really enjoy the adventure, know I want to play once again

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good stuff for fantasy lovers
reviews.reviewText: Awesome stuff for those who love the world of Dungeons and Dragons. Full of good humor, nicely illustrated there are 3 stories packed with magic and adventures.The book is paperback, but despite being pretty big it’s not falling apart. The paper and print quality are there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I wasn't expecting a comic style book. I still enjoy the book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars good graphic novel but has binding issues
reviews.reviewText: i bought this to read on a long plane ride and while the novel itself is good the binding has much to be desired the first day I opened mine several of the middle pages just fell out of the binding before I could even read it while it may not seem like a huge deal and I was able to place them back where they go I feel like it should not have happened in the first place

reviews.reviewTitle: Surrender now evil or face the wrath of Boo
reviews.reviewText: This is an amazing did you like Baldur's Gate do you like D&D then you're going to like this this is minsc's and boo on three it's Adventures likeable characters swords and sorcery did I mention story there's an elf and turns himself into a dragon and how did they defeat it well I'm not going to spoil at but there is a pretty awesome part where minsc's throws boo yelling go for the eyes boo and did I mention boo is a miniature Giant spacehamster and that's just Story 1 and there are two other stories they're just as awesome

reviews.reviewTitle: Buen libro, excelente autor, edición regular y en ingles
reviews.reviewText: Un autor excelente, una pena la edición, es muy frágil, en tapa dura, y un poco más grande sería un 10.Yo ya pediría q estuviera traducido, pero es que algunos siempre queremos más.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 29, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I’ve only read the first novel and am absolutely loving it. I’d recommend for those who have played baldurs gate or just love the fantasy genre.If you have played the games then you should be familiar with minsc and be happy unless you disliked the character.

reviews.reviewTitle: Très bien mais trace de colle
reviews.reviewText: Le livre est très bien, rien à redire. Cependant il y a quelques traces de colle dessus qui s'enlèveront sans doute avec le temps.

Really interesting format bringing the three storylines together. Provides a good look at the different graphical treatments from the different artists for each story. The binding itself is somewhat subpar for the price, however. The first few pages came loose after the first reading (kinda like my copy of the 5e PHB actually). All in all, happy with the purchase. Good stories, good plot twists and great art.
